definition: along the river/the region around the river
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang

sentences.english: He poled the raft down the river.
Along the Yangtze River is a typical continental climate, the winter cold, summer warmth.
sentences.chinese: 沿江爲典型的大陸性氣候，冬季寒冷，夏季溫暖。

sentences.english: Jiangzhou, an important town along the Yangtze River, was of great strategic significance.
sentences.chinese: 江州爲沿江地帶的一大重鎮，戰略地位非常重要。

sentences.english: North of the road along the river, the road has been completely urbanized.
sentences.chinese: 沿江公路以北，道路已經完全城市化。

sentences.english: Awakening of Insects only mine is the Jiangnan region and along the river coincide with climate laws.
sentences.chinese: 驚蟄始雷的說法則與沿江江南地區的氣候規律相吻合。

sentences.english: The wall was built along the river in case of floods.
sentences.chinese: 沿江築了堤壩，以防漲水。

sentences.english: The winner will insertHuajiangin the boat head, and row their boat up the river to show their glory.
sentences.chinese: 得者把“花江”插在船頭，沿江而上，以爲榮耀。

sentences.english: This is the Riverside Scenic Belt.
The next day, they visited along the river.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，進行了“千谷溪探險”及沿江遊覽。

sentences.english: Their boat drops down the river.
sentences.chinese: 他們的船沿江漂流而下。
